intro: Piriqueta morongii, commonly known as the Morong's piriqueta, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its unique, palmate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in lowland rainforests and is often found in shaded, humid environments. Its ornamental value has led to its cultivation in botanical gardens and greenhouses. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
